service.description: Service properties for the Nexus service on DC/OS.

name.description: The name of this DC/OS service.

instances.description: Number of instances of your service.

cpus.description: CPU shares to allocate to Nexus.

mem.description: Memory (in MB) to allocate to Nexus.

disk.description: Number of disks to allocate to each service instance.

cmd.description: A shell command for your container to execute.

back_off_seconds.description: The amount of time (in seconds) before Marathon retries launching a failed task.

back_off_factor.description: The multiplicand to apply to the backoffSeconds value.

max_launch_delay_seconds.description: The maximum amount of time (in seconds) to wait, after applying the backoffSeconds and backoffFactor values, before attempting to restart failed tasks.

networking.description: Networking properties for the Nexus service on DC/OS.

service_endpoints.description: DC/OS can automatically generate a Service Address to connect to each of your load balanced endpoints.

name.description: Name your endpoint to search for it by a meaningful name, rather than the port number.

protocol.description: Protocol can be UDP, TCP or both. i.e. : "udp", "tcp", "udp, tcp". Most services will use TCP

load_balance_port.description: This port will be used to load balance this service address internally

service_port.description: This port will be used to load balance this service address externally.

volumes.description: Storage properties for the Nexus service on DC/OS.

volume_data.description: Volume configurations (root, mount, external). Please read Pre-Install Notes for setup for volumes.

container_path.description: The path of a volume on the container.

type.description: The type of a volume (root, mount, external) on the host to be used for persisting your service configuration and data.

profile.description: Disk profile to be used for volume.

external_volume_name.description: External volume name, not applicable for ROOT and MOUNT volume types.

health_checks.description: Health checks may be specified per application to be run against the application's instances.

delay_seconds.description: Time to wait until starting health check (default: 2).

grace_periods.description: Health check failures are ignored within this number of seconds or until the instance becomes healthy for the first time.

intervals.description: Number of seconds to wait between health checks.

timeout.description: Number of seconds after which a health check is considered a failure regardless of the response.

max_failures.description: Number of consecutive health check failures after which the unhealthy instance should be killed. HTTP & TCP health checks: If this value is 0, instances will not be killed if they fail the health check.

fetch.description: If your service requires additional files and/or archives of files, enter their URIs to download and, if necessary, extract these resources.
